title: RPi Server
text:
import RPi.GPIO as GPIO
GPIO.setmode(GPIO.BCM) # numbers from 0 to 40

pinout of a RPI 

pins_a = [7, 11, 13, 15, 19, 21, 23, 27] # high to low
pins_a.reverse()


pins_a

[27, 23, 21, 19, 15, 13, 11, 7]



GPIO.setup(pins_a, GPIO.OUT)


GPIO.output(pins_a, GPIO.HIGH)

title: 8bit-adder
text: This file will become your README and also the index of your documentation.

title: 8bit-adder
text:
Developer Guide
If you are new to using nbdev here are some useful pointers to get you started.

Install 8bit_adder in Development mode
# make sure 8bit_adder package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to 8bit_adder
$ nbdev_prepare

title: 8bit-adder
text:
Usage

Installation
Install latest from the GitHub repository:
$ pip install git+https://github.com/mone27/8bit-adder.git
or from conda
$ conda install -c mone27 8bit_adder
or from pypi
$ pip install 8bit_adder


Documentation
Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub repository’s pages. Additionally you can find package manager specific guidelines on conda and pypi respectively.
